color: #222222; font-family: Roboto, RobotoDraft, Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif; font-size: small; background-color: #ffffff

span.div: Hi Everyone! I hope everyone is doing well during the crazy and different times. I'm missing each and everyone of you. If you would like to contact me about anything please email me at: tina.billman@hardin.k12.mt.us or leave a message at my school number: 665-6357.

div.style: color: #222222; font-family: Roboto, RobotoDraft, Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif; font-size: small; background-color: #ffffff

span.div: If you would like from me to call you please leave a phone number you can be reached at. I would love to talk and visit with you about life, what you've been doing, school work, and just about anything really. I love and miss my students.

div.style: color: #222222; font-family: Roboto, RobotoDraft, Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif; font-size: small; background-color: #ffffff

span.style: font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif

span.style: font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif

div.span: Also, if you picked up or need an Upward Bound Application please email me or call me so we can figure out a way to get the application turned in. Dan Benge, with Upward Bound still plans on picking up the applications on April 3rd. Thanks!

span.style: font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap
font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: Hardin High School Senior Class of 2020,

span.style: font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: I hope this notice finds you safe and healthy. We at Jostens are working tirelessly behind the scenes to try to preserve your high school graduation any way we can. This is a special announcement letting you all know that we are scheduling a drive-up delivery of your announcement products and caps and gowns at the school on Tuesday April 21st from 11-1. Please follow the instructions below in order to make this a SAFE and efficient delivery event.

li.style: list-style-type: decimal; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre

span.style: font-size: 11pt; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: Please adhere to the safety guidelines of social distancing. Please STAY in your car as you work your way through the line. We will try to deliver the items as fast as we can in order to get you in and out in a timely matter.

li.style: list-style-type: decimal; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre

span.style: font-size: 11pt; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: Tables will be set up on the West side of the school in front of the main entrance. Please enter the parking lot on the south side of the parking lot and work your way through the line. After you receive your graduation items please exit the parking lot out the north exit (by the tennis courts). Please do not congregate anywhere on school grounds after receiving your items. Your safety and our safety are of the utmost importance during this drive-up delivery event.

li.style: list-style-type: decimal; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre

span.style: font-size: 11pt; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: Payments in form of cash or credit card will be accepted at the delivery. Notices were sent out via mail 4-9-20 to those students with a balance due. Please be on the look-out for these in your mail. If possible, please follow the instructions on that invoice to pay your balance due prior to coming to the delivery event in order to keep the line moving. If you have any questions, please feel free to call me (Jeremy) at (406)861-0403 or my wife Jessi at (406)860-1011.

span.style: font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: This is a difficult time for all of us and my heart goes out to the Class of 2020. You all have worked very hard for the last 13 years to get to this moment. You all deserve to be recognized and celebrated for your commitment and dedication to your education. See you on the 21st!!!!

span.style: font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: Sincerely,

span.style: font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: Jeremy Sawicki

span.style: font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: Jostens

span.style: font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

li.style: margin: 0px 0px 0.5em 15px; overflow-wrap: break-word; line-height: 16.9px

ul.li: The MHSA Executive Board, during a conference call to conduct Association business on Thursday morning, took the following action regarding MHSA Spring Activities: All MHSA spring activities will be suspended through April 24th. This includes practices and contests/meet/festivals. Resumption of spring activities will depend on our student’s ability to return to in-person instruction by May 4th. If in-person instruction doesn’t resume by that time, spring activities will be cancelled. We take seriously the directives from the Governor, State Health Department and CDC for the safety of our students and for their communities. Their safety is our top priority during these challenging times.

li.style: margin: 0px 0px 0.5em 15px; overflow-wrap: break-word; line-height: 16.9px; text-align: justify

span.style: overflow-wrap: break-word; font-family: arial, sans-serif
overflow-wrap: break-word; font-size: 10pt

span.span: If spring activities are resumed, the practice requirement for sports at that time will be five practices from resumption except for golf which will be the normal two practices required.

li.style: margin: 0px 0px 0.5em 15px; overflow-wrap: break-word; line-height: 16.9px; text-align: justify

span.style: overflow-wrap: break-word; font-family: arial, sans-serif
overflow-wrap: break-word; font-size: 10pt

span.span: If spring activities are resumed, post season formats will be adjusted by the MHSA with Executive Board approval.

p.style: margin: 0px 0in 1em 0.5in; overflow-wrap: break-word; line-height: 18.2px; color: #333333; text-align: justify

span.style: overflow-wrap: break-word; font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.5em
overflow-wrap: break-word; font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.5em; font-family: arial, sans-serif
overflow-wrap: break-word; font-size: 10pt; line-height: 1.5em

span.span: The MHSA April Executive Board meeting scheduled for April 20-21 has been postponed tentatively until May 18-19, 2020, depending on the directives from the Governor, State Health Department at that time.

p.style: margin: 0px 0in 1em; overflow-wrap: break-word; line-height: 18.2px; color: #333333; text-align: justify

span.style: overflow-wrap: break-word; font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.5em
overflow-wrap: break-word; font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.5em; font-family: arial, sans-serif
overflow-wrap: break-word; font-size: 10pt; line-height: 1.5em

span.span: Thank you and if you have any questions please feel free to contact me.

span.style: overflow-wrap: break-word; font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.5em; color: #01209e
overflow-wrap: break-word; font-size: 1em; line-height: 1.5em; font-family: helvetica, sans-serif
overflow-wrap: break-word; font-size: 10.5pt; line-height: 1.5em

div.a: Hardin School Districts 17H & 1 CLOSURE due to COVID-19 Update #5

p.span: April 3, 2020

br.span: To: Hardin School Districts 17H & 1 Students, Parents and Community Members

p.span: Re: Hardin School Districts 17H & 1 CLOSURE due to COVID-19 Update #5
Dear Students, Staff and Community Members,

I just wanted to extend another “thank you” to our staff, students, parents and community members; we appreciate the patience and flexibility you have displayed during our school closures. We realize the frustrations and complexities that this closure has brought us all; however, we continue to listen, adapt and ultimately provide the best services we possibly can during this emergency. Please see the contact information below should you have and questions or concerns. Thank you…
In our best effort to keep our school community informed, I wanted to put out some new information as we approach the end of the week and ultimately, the weekend…

li.style: font-size: 10.5px; font-family: Helvetica
li.span: Montana Governor Steve Bullock ordered a “stay at home” or “shelter-in-place” directive effective 12:01 a.m. on Saturday, March 28, 2020. We at Hardin School Districts 17H & 1 encourage you to take the directive seriously and follow the guideline as established by his proclamation that we will post here shortly! You will notice new signs throughout the District encouraging all staff, students, parents and community members to follow the directives of the CDC, federal and state agencies…as well as Big Horn County. PLEASE consider the safety and well-being of all individuals!

li.style: font-size: 10.5px; font-family: Helvetica

span.style: text-decoration-line: underline;font-size:14px

li.span: the Districts’ educational plans for the remainder of the school year, should he continue to mandate school building closures. I do expect the Governor to extend the closure date perhaps another couple weeks…taking us nearly to the end of April. If this is the case, we will continue to do our best to meet our educational plan goals and serve the students and families of Hardin School Districts 17H & 1.

li.style: font-size: 10.5px; font-family: Helvetica
li.span: School nutrition will continue to serve meals daily Monday through Friday on originally planned school days (we will NOT be serving meals Friday, April 10 or Monday, April 13, 2020 due to Easter weekend). Please remember that any individuals eighteen (18) and younger are eligible for the service and NEED NOT BE PRESENT in order to pick up lunches/breakfasts. Thank you!

li.style: font-size: 10.5px; font-family: Helvetica

b.i: ***ON A SPECIAL NOTE – THANK YOU TO ALL THE STAFF AND VOLUNTEERS THAT HAVE MADE OUR SCHOOL NUTRITION SERVICES SO AMAZING! THE INDIVIDUALS THAT HAVE COME IN THE LAST THREE WEEKS HAVE GONE “ABOVE AND BEYOND” ANY EXPECTATIONS ARE SIMPLY AMAZING! THESE INCREDIBLE PEOPLE PUSH OUT OVER 2000 MEALS PER DAY…YOU ARE THE BEST!!

li.style: font-size: 10.5px; font-family: Helvetica
li.span: Should you have any health related questions that may pertain to the school and your students; we have created a “School Nurse Contact Form” found on our school website at http://www.hardin.k12.mt.us.

li.style: font-size: 10.5px; font-family: Helvetica
li.span: We have created two avenues to contact the school if you should have questions, concerns or comments. We can be reached through a central contact phone number at 406-665-9312 Monday – Thursday between the hours of 8:00 a.m. and 4:00 p.m. We can be reached by email at help@hardin.k12.mt.us. The purpose of these contacts are to streamline our concerns and comments to look for trends or situations that may need to be addressed at the district/school level.

p.span: Hardin School Districts 17H & 1

div.a: Community Letter of Closure March 27 2020 Update #4

span.style: font-size: 10.5pt; font-family: "Helvetica Neue", sans-serif; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: March 27, 2020

span.style: font-size: 10.5pt; font-family: "Helvetica Neue", sans-serif; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: To: Hardin School Districts 17H & 1 Students, Parents and Community Members

span.style: font-size: 10.5pt; font-family: "Helvetica Neue", sans-serif; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: Re: Hardin School Districts 17H & 1 CLOSURE due to COVID-19 Update #4

span.style: font-size: 10.5pt; font-family: "Helvetica Neue", sans-serif; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: Dear Students, Staff and Community Members,

span.style: font-size: 10.5pt; font-family: "Helvetica Neue", sans-serif; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: Good morning…again, we appreciate the patience and flexibility that our students, staff, parents and community have displayed during our school closures.

span.style: font-size: 10.5pt; font-family: "Helvetica Neue", sans-serif; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: In our best effort to keep our school community informed, I wanted to put out some new information as we approach the end of the week and ultimately, the weekend…

li.style: list-style-type: disc; font-size: 10.5pt; font-family: "Helvetica Neue", sans-serif; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre

span.style: font-size: 10.5pt; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: Montana Governor Steve Bullock has ordered a “stay at home” or “shelter-in-place” directive effective 12:01 a.m. on Saturday, March 28, 2020. We are Hardin School Districts 17H & 1 encourage you to take the directive seriously and follow the guideline as established by his proclamation that we will post here shortly! As of now and in the immediate near future, this will not change any of our plans to continue to provide educational services or meals as already published by the District.

li.style: list-style-type: disc; font-size: 10.5pt; font-family: "Helvetica Neue", sans-serif; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre

span.style: font-size: 10.5pt; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: School nutrition will continue to serve meals daily Monday through Friday on originally planned school days as outlined in the new flyer being published today…adding a Muddy Cluster stop starting this coming Monday, March 20, 2020. We will monitor the usage of the program today, as well as adapt as we get a better idea of our needs across the service area. Please remember that any individuals eighteen (18) and younger are eligible for the service and NEED NOT BE PRESENT in order to pick up lunches/breakfasts. Thank you!

li.style: list-style-type: disc; font-size: 10.5pt; font-family: "Helvetica Neue", sans-serif; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre

span.style: font-size: 10.5pt; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: Please see our “Student-Parent Letter on Educational Services” that will also be published shortly for updates on how these services will be provided.

li.style: list-style-type: disc; font-size: 10.5pt; font-family: "Helvetica Neue", sans-serif; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre

span.style: font-size: 10.5pt; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: In addition, should you have any health related questions that may pertain to the school and your students; we have created a “School Nurse Contact Form” found on our school website at

span.style: font-size: 10.5pt; color: #0563c1; background-color: transparent; text-decoration-line: underline; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap
font-size: 10.5pt; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

li.style: list-style-type: disc; font-size: 10.5pt; font-family: "Helvetica Neue", sans-serif; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre

span.style: font-size: 10.5pt; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: We have created two avenues to contact the school if you should have questions, concerns or comments. We can be reached through a central contact phone number at 406-665-9312 Monday – Thursday between the hours of 8:00 a.m. and 4:00 p.m. We can be reached by email at

span.style: font-size: 10.5pt; color: #0563c1; background-color: transparent; text-decoration-line: underline; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap
font-size: 10.5pt; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: . The purpose of these contacts are to streamline our concerns and comments to look for trends or situations that may need to be addressed at the district/school level.

span.style: font-size: 10.5pt; font-family: "Helvetica Neue", sans-serif; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap
font-size: 10.5pt; font-family: "Helvetica Neue", sans-serif; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: Respectfully,

span.style: font-size: 10.5pt; font-family: "Helvetica Neue", sans-serif; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: Eldon C. Johnson, Supt

div.a: Student-Parent Letter on Educational Services March 27 2020

span.style: font-size: 12pt; font-family: Arial; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 700; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: NOTICE TO STUDENTS & PARENTS OF HARDIN SCHOOL DISTRICTS 17H & 1

span.style: font-size: 12pt; font-family: Arial; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 700; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: March 27, 2020

span.style: font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: Greetings from the Hardin School Districts 17H & 1 District Office…wishing you safety and good health during this unprecedented time in educational history! Again, I want to thank you for your flexibility and understanding as we prepare to meet the Governor’s directives in providing educational services to all of our students during this time of closure. Directives and recommendations from all levels on how schools should be responding is changing by the hour…we are doing our best to “keep up” with the mandates from state/national levels.

span.style: font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: STARTING

span.style: font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 700; text-decoration-line: underline; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: MARCH 30, 2020

span.style: font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: , THIS WILL BE OUR EDUCATIONAL PROCEDURES FOR THE REMAINDER OF THE YEAR OR UNTIL SCHOOL RESUMES…

li.style: list-style-type: disc; font-size: 10pt; font-family: "Noto Sans Symbols", sans-serif; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre; margin-left: -18.1pt

span.style: font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 700; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: Kindergarten Readiness Center

span.style: font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: – All materials were available for distribution today (March 23, 2020) from 10:00 a.m. to 12:00 p.m. This packet will cover the week of March 23, 2020 only. New packets

span.style: font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 700; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: AND

span.style: font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: any student material to be returned to teachers will follow the same timeframe, MONDAYS from 10:00 a.m. to 12:00 p.m.!

p.span: – All educational packets are ready for pick up at Crow School Monday (3/23/20) and Tuesday (3/24/20) between the hours of 8:00 a.m. and 1:00 p.m. This packet will cover the week of March 23, 2020 only…new packets

p.span: AND

span.style: font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

span.style: font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 700; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: Fort Smith School

span.style: font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: – All educational materials are ready for pick up at St. Xavier (10:30 am -11:00 am) AND Fort Smith Post Office (11:30 a.m. to 12:00 p.m.), Monday (3/23/20) and Tuesday (3/24/20). This packet will cover the week of March 23, 2020 only. New packets

span.style: font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 700; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: AND

span.style: font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: student materials to be returned to teachers will follow the same locations and times; however, this exchange will only occur on Mondays.

li.style: list-style-type: disc; font-size: 10pt; font-family: "Noto Sans Symbols", sans-serif; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre; margin-left: -18.1pt

span.style: font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 700; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: Hardin Primary School

span.style: font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap
font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial; color: #222222; background-color: #ffffff; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: All educational packets were distributed this week. The few remaining packets were mailed home. Packets will cover up to April 9th. Contact your homeroom teacher for Class Dojo access(

span.style: font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial; color: #1155cc; background-color: #ffffff; text-decoration-line: underline; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap
font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial; color: #222222; background-color: #ffffff; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: ) if you have not already done so, this is the best way to connect with your teacher and continued virtual learning packets. If Closure continues past April 14, 2020…New packets will be made available.

li.style: list-style-type: disc; font-size: 10pt; font-family: "Noto Sans Symbols", sans-serif; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre; margin-left: -18.1pt

span.style: font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 700; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: Hardin Intermediate School

span.style: font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: – All educational packets were available last week for pick up; they were also distributed at Crow School today (March 23, 2020) and will be available at the HARDIN MIDDLE SCHOOL tomorrow (March 24, 2020) from 11:30 a.m. – 1:00 p.m. This packet will cover the THREE weeks of school from March 23, 2020 to April 10, 2020. New packets

span.style: font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 700; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: AND

span.style: font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: student materials to be returned to teachers will follow the same timeframe, MONDAYS and TUESDAYS from 11:00 a.m. to 12:30 p.m. Should the schools be closed past April 14, 2020…HIS will go to a weekly schedule to remain consistent with the rest of the District.

li.style: list-style-type: disc; font-size: 10pt; font-family: "Noto Sans Symbols", sans-serif; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre; margin-left: -18.1pt

span.style: font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 700; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: Hardin Middle School

span.style: font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: – Parents and/or students may return completed lesson assignments and pick up new individualized educational packets Monday (4/6/20) and Tuesday (4/7/20) at the following locations and times: Hardin Middle School (11:30 am to 1:00 pm), Crow School (11:30 am to 1:00 pm), St. Xavier Post Office (10:30 am -11:00 am), Fort Smith Post Office (11:30 am to 12:00 pm), and Busby Post Office (12:00 pm - 1:00 pm). This weekly schedule will remain consistent should schools be closed past April 10, 2020. All lessons are provided via the Internet and students are encouraged to complete lessons digitally if possible.

li.style: list-style-type: disc; font-size: 10pt; font-family: "Noto Sans Symbols", sans-serif; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre; margin-left: -18.1pt

span.style: font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 700; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: Hardin High School

span.style: font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: – All educational packets can be picked up at Hardin Middle School and Crow Agency School Wednesday’s between the hours of 11:30 a.m. to 1:00 p.m. Instructional materials will be ready for pick up at St. Xavier Post Office (10:30 a.m. -11:00 a.m.), Fort Smith Post Office (11:30 a.m. to 12:00 p.m.) and Busby Post Office (12:00 p.m. - 1:00 p.m.) on Wednesdays. This packet will cover ONE or TWO weeks of school as explained in the packet. Completed work will be returned at the same times and locations. Students who have internet capabilities

span.style: font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 700; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: do not

span.style: font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: need paper copies.

span.style: font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: Please note that the above dates and times are not valid if they should fall on a non-school day or holiday!

span.style: font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: In addition, school delivery of packets will be a “work in progress”…we may need to adapt the times and locations depending on the needs of our students.

span.style: font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 700; font-style: italic; text-decoration-line: underline; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: Please feel free to contact our “help hotline” at 1-406-665-9312 Monday through Thursday between the hours of 8:00 a.m. - 4:00 p.m. should you have any questions or comments regarding school nutrition or any other topics. You can also email us at

span.style: font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial; color: #1155cc; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 700; font-style: italic; text-decoration-line: underline; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap
font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 700; font-style: italic; text-decoration-line: underline; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: as well.

span.style: font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: Thank you!

span.style: font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: We appreciate your understanding and flexibility as we continue to travel through uncharted waters. Have a great weekend and please stay safe!

span.style: font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: Eldon C. Johnson, Supt

span.style: font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

div.span: Montana GEAR UP Surveys for Parents and Students

GEAR UP hopes to see you succeed in college and your career after high school. We would like to hear about your plans and get your feedback about how we can help you meet your goals. This survey will take 5 to 10 minutes. You can take the survey on a computer, a phone, or a tablet. Please complete the survey by May 8, 2020.

Please help us improve GEAR UP for your child or children by taking this survey. The survey will take 5 to 10 minutes to complete. You can take the survey on a computer, phone, tablet or other mobile device. Paper surveys are also available from your GEAR UP liaison. Please complete the survey by May 8, 2020.

Please come in to the schools if you are new to our district. You will fill out the form in the above link and then the school staff will have to enroll your child. We will then give you usernames and passwords to complete the enrollment forms.

div.br:
In partnership with parents and community we will provide equal opportunities for students to acquire the knowledge
and skills that foster responsible choices. The school community will nurture, challenge, and guide students towards
achieving their maximum potential.
